result.execSummary:
The defendant Justina Santiago was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1,770.00 payable to Valerie N-M., Ordered FORTHWITH converted to a civil judgment With Tax intercept.
Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and fees by 10-25-2019 or civil judgment will be entered with Tax intercept.

UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE SENTENCE, COURT WILL GRANT EXPUNGEMENT IF DEFENDANT SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETES SENTENCE AND HAS NO FURTHER VIOLATIONS OF THE LAW WITHIN TWO (2) YEARS, UPON SUBMISSION OF MOTION.

EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR RESTITUTION
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Huber privileges for work and childcare. GOOD TIME TO APPLY. Defendant to report to CJF by 10-30-2017 at 5pm FOR BOOKING

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justina Santiago

records.addlTxt: Restitution packet, Check issued March 7, 2018.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing Referral Form.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Justina Santiago in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve FORTY-FIVE (45) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for THIRTY-THREE (33) DAYS time served.  GOOD TIME TO APPLY.  Huber privileges for work and childcare.  Consecutive to any other sentence. DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE CJF BY 10-30-2017 AT 05:00 PM FOR BOOKING.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Restitution payable to VALERIE N-M for ONE THOUSAND SEVEN HUNDRED SEVENTY DOLLARS ($1,770.00) ordered converted to a civil judgment WITH tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and fees BY 10-25-2019 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law WITHIN TWO (2) YEARS, upon submission of motion.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR RESTITUTION.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.
STRAIGHT RELEASE.  Defendant is NOT turnover to JusticePoint.

Defendant Justina Santiago in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Justina Santiago in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  GLORIA S appeared on behalf of the Defendant.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Matter was scheduled for Sentencing.  State advised that the Victim has NOT been notified.  Court addressed the Parties.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant to the Court.  Filed, sdg.
On behalf of Defendant from KATHERINE M.  Filed, sdg.
On behalf of Defendant from CHRISTY J.  Filed, sdg.
On behalf of Defendant from SARAH A.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Justina Santiago not in court, in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense WAIVED the appearance of the Defendant for the purposes of this hearing.  Defendant last missed a Sentencing date.  State moved for REMAND.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT DATE.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Attorney Fred Klimetz is hereby appointed as Counsel of Record.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
By Agreement of the Parties.  Matter is RESCHEDULED to 02-21-2017 at 01:30 pm for Sentencing.  sdg
Court is DOWN 01-13-2017.  Matter is RESCHEDULED to 01-20-2017 at 02:30 pm for Sentencing.  sdg

Defendant Justina Santiago in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State advised that at the November 2, 2016 Staffing,  they decided that they would be moving to REVOKE.  State RENEWED their motion to REVOKE.  Defense and Defendant conceded that there is a factual basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant is ill.  Defense requested an adjournment.  State did NOT object.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for December 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint DPA Non-compliance Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Justina Santiago in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant is still testing POSITIVE.  State moved to REVOKE.  Defense advised that Defendant has tendered ONE HUNDRED AND THIRTY DOLLARS ($130.00) towards Restitution.  Defense has a handwritten letter (NOT on letterhead) verifying FIFTEEN (15) HOURS of Community Service.  Defendant is the sole parent of a child.  Defendant is working TWO (2) jobs.  Court went off the Record to hold Sidebar in Chambers.  Hearing continued on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  COURT TOOK THE MOTION TO REVOKE UNDER ADVISEMENT AT THIS TIME.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for November 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
HEARING DATED 08-30-2016 WAS HELD ON THE RECORD,  HOWEVER,  DUE TO EQUIPMENT FAILURE THERE IS NO RECORDING AVAILABLE.  sdg

Defendant Justina Santiago in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant advised that she is currently working around SIXTY (60) HOURS per week.  Defendant has completed the Letter of Apology.  State advised that if Defendant continues to test POSITIVE she runs the risk of having the DPA REVOKED.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for October 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Justina Santiago in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Prior to matter being called on the Record,  case was Staffed in Chambers.  Matter before the Court to address JusticePoint Violation Report.  Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court went off the Record to contact Defendant's workplace.  Hearing continued on the Record.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TURNED OVER TO JUSTICEPOINT FOR RELEASE.  UPON RELEASE BAIL TO REVERT TO $500.00 PR BOND.  Matter remains scheduled for Review before Br. 33 on 08-30-2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Justina Santiago in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  nam

Case proceeded with review hearing. Defendant has just started working and has started the community service. State advises court the defendant needs to start paying restitution and needs to keep drug tests negative. Court orders defendant to make an effort on paying the restitution. Defense advises court the victim has been making contact with the defendants job. Court orders case adjourned for Review Hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for August 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint DPA Non-Compliance Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Justina Santiago in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Non compliant. No sanctions given.  Case scheduled for a Review Hearing on 06-28-16 at 01:30 pm in Branch 33.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Justina Santiago in court.  Attorney Klimetz appeared at 08:15 am and waited until 08:40 am.  Defendant did not arrive until 09:15 am.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Attorney Klimetz is in trial.  Defendant did test positive TODAY (04-26-2016).  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Justina Santiago in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Review hearing proceeded on the Reord.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court admonished Defendant for testing positive.  Defendant advised that she has located a place at which to perform Community Service.  Defense advised that she is attending 'Word of Hope'.  Defendant will show that documentation to JusticePoint.  State advised that Defendant owes NINETEEN HUNDRED DOLLARS ($1,900.00) in Restitution.  Defendant advised that she just received a promotion and will therefore be able to pay more towards Restitution.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Justina Santiago in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Court held colloquy with Defendant.  State would like to see negative UA's.  Defendant needs to begin the other requirements of the DPA.  Defense advises the Court that Defendant works TWO (2) jobs and is aware of the conditions of the DPA.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

As to COUNTS 1 & 3-
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 1 & 3 dismissed but read in.

Defendant Justina Santiago in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for DPA hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. State placed negotiations on the record. Court finds the State has complied with the victim rights legislation. Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 2-
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. 

Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  
Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  
Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Justina Santiago in court. Attorney Curt Rogers appeared via telephone.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for DPA hearing. Attorney Rogers appeard via phone before the case was called and advised the court he is unable to appear due to a medical appointment. Court granted request for adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Justina Santiago in court with attorney Curt Rogers.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for deferred prosecution agreement hearing. State requested an adjournment pending victim notification. Defense counsel does not object. Court granted State's request for adjournment. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Justina Santiago in court with attorney Curt Rogers.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared on behalf of Steven Glamm for the State of Wisconsin. Parties advise that defendant has been accepted into the Justice Point treatment program; still needs to be staffed.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Case is continued before Branch 25; all terms and conditions of bail continue.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Justina Santiago in court.  Attorney Curt Rogers contacted the court to advise he was ill and unable to appear.  Mutually agreeable date selected off the record with ADA Steven Glamm.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and ordered case set for hearing before Branch 20.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Justina Santiago in court with attorney Curt Rogers.  
Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder for Steven Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.; possible deferred prosecution agreement.
  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Justina Santiago in court with attorney Curt Rogers.  Ronald Dague for James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Justina Santiago in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court, due to a conflict with the State Public Defender's Office. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Valarie M.

ADDRESS INFO for Justina Santiago
Current: 1567 S. 2nd Street, UPPER, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 05-29-2015)
Prior: 2171 South 6th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Defendant Justina Santiago in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  As to counts 2 and 3 Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Justina Santiago not in court.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on  4-22-2015 at 1:30pm
